roleset.name: having an opinion, feeling tenderly/strongly for/about

role.descr: entity who has an opinion, cares

example.name: care-v; transitive
example.text: They desperately needed somebody who [*T*-93] showed [0]they cared for them , who [*T*-94] loved them .

example.name: care-v; intransitive
example.text: [*-1] Asked [*-2]whether potential advertisers will be scared [*-83] away by the magazine 's direct policy , Ms. Poore replies : `` I do n't know and I do n't care .

example.name: care-v; transitive with adverbials
example.text: `` An active 55-year-old in Boca Raton may care more about Senior Olympic games , while a 75-year-old in Panama City may caremore about a seminar on health , '' she says [*T*-1].
example.arg: while a 75-year-old in Panama City may care more about a seminar on health

example.name: care-v; sentential Arg1
example.text: `` [*] Give me four or five more Series with these guys , andI do n't care if I ever win a Cy Young , '' he said [*T*-1], inreference to baseball 's best-pitcher award .
example.arg: if I ever win a Cy Young

example.name: idc-v; abbreviated
example.text: Yeah I mean I 'd prolly be last resort . I got no plans for Saturday but *PRO* IDC bout arena football too much . If other pplwould rather go take them

example.name: care-n
example.text: He now tells them of His care for His children.

example.name: caring-n; both args
example.text: Obviously, there are a multitude of different ways that occupational therapists show their caring for their clients

roleset.note: CARE-V NOTES: Original file, 'care-v.01', based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. The original file encompassed allsenses of the verb. Member of VNcls care-88.1, marvel-31.3. CARE-N NOTES: Original file, 'care-n.01', based on care-v.01.IDC-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. Relation to care.01(from idc.01-v)

roleset.name: liking/desiring/wanting

role.descr: what arg0 does or doesn't want/like (to do)

example.name: care-v: care for
example.text: I don't care for spinach

example.name: care-v: care to
example.text: I don't care to eat spinach

example.name: care-v
example.text: Would you care for some more spinach?

example.name: caring-n
example.text: My not caring for spinach doesn't mean it has no nutritional value.

roleset.note: CARE-N NOTES: CARING-N NOTES:This parent frame file reframed by Julia after discussion withMartha, Tim, Katie and Ulf. The former file consisted of a singleroleset, which encompassed all usages. The new rolesets have finesenses, which allow more consistency in unification of the variousaliases.

roleset.name: tending, taking care of

example.name: care-v
example.text: I care for 10 patients a day

example.name: care-n: Light Verb Construction
example.text: In those days , people as a rule did not take much care of phonograph records .

example.name: care-n; intransitive
example.text: She started helping me out a few months ago and I continue to be thrilled with her care of my girls.

example.name: NOT EVENTIVE! Call this .YY!
example.text: A sober guest trucks her off to urgent care to get stitches while someone else tries to wash the blood off the dance floor .

roleset.note: This parent frame file reframed by Julia after discussion with Martha, Tim, Katie and Ulf. The former file consisted of a singleroleset, which encompassed all usages. The new rolesets have finesenses, which allow more consistency in unification of the variousaliases.

roleset.name: being cautious, taking care to

example.name: care-n: lVC
example.text: He took care to drive in his lane.

example.name: care-n
example.text: He was rewarded for his care in driving in his own lane by not getting into an accident
example.arg: in driving in his own lane

example.name: careful-j; intransitive
example.text: If a girl is raped , it is not her fault even if she did n't take the adequate measures to mitigate risk , because that riskwould have been there irrespective of [how careful]-3 she may havebeen [*T*-3].

example.name: careful-j; both args
example.text: Mark Twain - "*PRO* Be careful about reading health books. Youmay die of a misprint."

example.name: careful-j; concatenation only required if tree provides no trace
example.text: One must always be careful of books, said Tessa, and what is inside them, for words have the power to change us.
example.arg: for words have the power to change us

roleset.note: CAREFUL-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1. (from careful.01-j)
